title.narrative: CHILD-FOCUSED INVESTMENTS

description.narrative: Child-focused investments are bolstered by strong and equitable national plans and budgets, legislative scrutiny and advocacy.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration
Other General Services support to civil society
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child-focused investments are bolstered by strong and equitable national plans and budgets, legislative scrutiny and advocacy.

description.narrative: UNICEF work in public finance for children (PF4C) contributed to achieve concrete and significant gains in protecting public investment for children, despite a severe financial and economic crisis. Financial transparency and oversight of Ministry of Finance, Parliament was strengthened, thanks to a coordinated evidence based advocacy for Child-focused investments. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of annual State Budget Proposals in the CP cycle that civil society and Parliament review together

(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of functioning mechanisms for public engagement to influence development agendas in the local, subnational or national plans that affect the most disadvantaged and marginalized
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Partnership/collaboration for policy advocacy for children is established with civic society, NGOs/CSOs, private sector or Parliament Committees
